fields.name: DATA
fields.description: Receive (read) data character. Transmit (write) data character.

fields.name: FE
fields.description: Framing error. When set to 1, it indicates that the received character did not have a valid stop bit (a valid stop bit is 1). In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO.

fields.name: PE
fields.description: Parity error. When set to 1, it indicates that the parity of the received data character does not match the parity that the EPS and SPS bits in the Line Control Register, UARTLCR_H. In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO.

fields.name: BE
fields.description: Break error. This bit is set to 1 if a break condition was detected, indicating that the received data input was held LOW for longer than a full-word transmission time (defined as start, data, parity and stop bits). In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO. When a break occurs, only one 0 character is loaded into the FIFO. The next character is only enabled after the receive data input goes to a 1 (marking state), and the next valid start bit is received.

fields.name: OE
fields.description: Overrun error. This bit is set to 1 if data is received and the receive FIFO is already full. This is cleared to 0 once there is an empty space in the FIFO and a new character can be written to it.

registers.description: Data Register, UARTDR

registers.name: UARTRSR

fields.name: FE
fields.description: Framing error. When set to 1, it indicates that the received character did not have a valid stop bit (a valid stop bit is 1). This bit is cleared to 0 by a write to UARTECR. In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO.

fields.name: PE
fields.description: Parity error. When set to 1, it indicates that the parity of the received data character does not match the parity that the EPS and SPS bits in the Line Control Register, UARTLCR_H. This bit is cleared to 0 by a write to UARTECR. In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO.

fields.name: BE
fields.description: Break error. This bit is set to 1 if a break condition was detected, indicating that the received data input was held LOW for longer than a full-word transmission time (defined as start, data, parity, and stop bits). This bit is cleared to 0 after a write to UARTECR. In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO. When a break occurs, only one 0 character is loaded into the FIFO. The next character is only enabled after the receive data input goes to a 1 (marking state) and the next valid start bit is received.

fields.name: OE
fields.description: Overrun error. This bit is set to 1 if data is received and the FIFO is already full. This bit is cleared to 0 by a write to UARTECR. The FIFO contents remain valid because no more data is written when the FIFO is full, only the contents of the shift register are overwritten. The CPU must now read the data, to empty the FIFO.

registers.description: Receive Status Register/Error Clear Register, UARTRSR/UARTECR

registers.name: UARTFR

fields.name: CTS
fields.description: Clear to send. This bit is the complement of the UART clear to send, nUARTCTS, modem status input. That is, the bit is 1 when nUARTCTS is LOW.

fields.name: DSR
fields.description: Data set ready. This bit is the complement of the UART data set ready, nUARTDSR, modem status input. That is, the bit is 1 when nUARTDSR is LOW.

fields.name: DCD
fields.description: Data carrier detect. This bit is the complement of the UART data carrier detect, nUARTDCD, modem status input. That is, the bit is 1 when nUARTDCD is LOW.

fields.name: BUSY
fields.description: UART busy. If this bit is set to 1, the UART is busy transmitting data. This bit remains set until the complete byte, including all the stop bits, has been sent from the shift register. This bit is set as soon as the transmit FIFO becomes non-empty, regardless of whether the UART is enabled or not.

fields.name: RXFE
fields.description: Receive FIFO empty. The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the UARTLCR_H Register. If the FIFO is disabled, this bit is set when the receive holding register is empty. If the FIFO is enabled, the RXFE bit is set when the receive FIFO is empty.

fields.name: TXFF
fields.description: Transmit FIFO full. The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the UARTLCR_H Register. If the FIFO is disabled, this bit is set when the transmit holding register is full. If the FIFO is enabled, the TXFF bit is set when the transmit FIFO is full.

fields.name: RXFF
fields.description: Receive FIFO full. The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the UARTLCR_H Register. If the FIFO is disabled, this bit is set when the receive holding register is full. If the FIFO is enabled, the RXFF bit is set when the receive FIFO is full.

fields.name: TXFE
fields.description: Transmit FIFO empty. The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the Line Control Register, UARTLCR_H. If the FIFO is disabled, this bit is set when the transmit holding register is empty. If the FIFO is enabled, the TXFE bit is set when the transmit FIFO is empty. This bit does not indicate if there is data in the transmit shift register.

fields.name: RI
fields.description: Ring indicator. This bit is the complement of the UART ring indicator, nUARTRI, modem status input. That is, the bit is 1 when nUARTRI is LOW.

registers.description: Flag Register, UARTFR

registers.name: UARTILPR

fields.name: ILPDVSR
fields.description: 8-bit low-power divisor value. These bits are cleared to 0 at reset.

registers.description: IrDA Low-Power Counter Register, UARTILPR

registers.name: UARTIBRD

fields.name: BAUD_DIVINT
fields.description: The integer baud rate divisor. These bits are cleared to 0 on reset.

registers.description: Integer Baud Rate Register, UARTIBRD

registers.name: UARTFBRD

fields.name: BAUD_DIVFRAC
fields.description: The fractional baud rate divisor. These bits are cleared to 0 on reset.

registers.description: Fractional Baud Rate Register, UARTFBRD

registers.name: UARTLCR_H

fields.name: BRK
fields.description: Send break. If this bit is set to 1, a low-level is continually output on the UARTTXD output, after completing transmission of the current character. For the proper execution of the break command, the software must set this bit for at least two complete frames. For normal use, this bit must be cleared to 0.

fields.name: PEN
fields.description: Parity enable: 0 = parity is disabled and no parity bit added to the data frame 1 = parity checking and generation is enabled.

fields.name: EPS
fields.description: Even parity select. Controls the type of parity the UART uses during transmission and reception: 0 = odd parity. The UART generates or checks for an odd number of 1s in the data and parity bits. 1 = even parity. The UART generates or checks for an even number of 1s in the data and parity bits. This bit has no effect when the PEN bit disables parity checking and generation.

fields.name: STP2
fields.description: Two stop bits select. If this bit is set to 1, two stop bits are transmitted at the end of the frame. The receive logic does not check for two stop bits being received.

fields.name: FEN
fields.description: Enable FIFOs: 0 = FIFOs are disabled (character mode) that is, the FIFOs become 1-byte-deep holding registers 1 = transmit and receive FIFO buffers are enabled (FIFO mode).

fields.name: WLEN
fields.description: Word length. These bits indicate the number of data bits transmitted or received in a frame as follows: b11 = 8 bits b10 = 7 bits b01 = 6 bits b00 = 5 bits.

fields.name: SPS
fields.description: Stick parity select. 0 = stick parity is disabled 1 = either: * if the EPS bit is 0 then the parity bit is transmitted and checked as a 1 * if the EPS bit is 1 then the parity bit is transmitted and checked as a 0. This bit has no effect when the PEN bit disables parity checking and generation.

registers.description: Line Control Register, UARTLCR_H

registers.name: UARTCR

fields.name: UARTEN
fields.description: UART enable: 0 = UART is disabled. If the UART is disabled in the middle of transmission or reception, it completes the current character before stopping. 1 = the UART is enabled. Data transmission and reception occurs for either UART signals or SIR signals depending on the setting of the SIREN bit.

fields.name: SIREN
fields.description: SIR enable: 0 = IrDA SIR ENDEC is disabled. nSIROUT remains LOW (no light pulse generated), and signal transitions on SIRIN have no effect. 1 = IrDA SIR ENDEC is enabled. Data is transmitted and received on nSIROUT and SIRIN. UARTTXD remains HIGH, in the marking state. Signal transitions on UARTRXD or modem status inputs have no effect. This bit has no effect if the UARTEN bit disables the UART.

fields.name: SIRLP
fields.description: SIR low-power IrDA mode. This bit selects the IrDA encoding mode. If this bit is cleared to 0, low-level bits are transmitted as an active high pulse with a width of 3 / 16th of the bit period. If this bit is set to 1, low-level bits are transmitted with a pulse width that is 3 times the period of the IrLPBaud16 input signal, regardless of the selected bit rate. Setting this bit uses less power, but might reduce transmission distances.

fields.name: LBE
fields.description: Loopback enable. If this bit is set to 1 and the SIREN bit is set to 1 and the SIRTEST bit in the Test Control Register, UARTTCR is set to 1, then the nSIROUT path is inverted, and fed through to the SIRIN path. The SIRTEST bit in the test register must be set to 1 to override the normal half-duplex SIR operation. This must be the requirement for accessing the test registers during normal operation, and SIRTEST must be cleared to 0 when loopback testing is finished. This feature reduces the amount of external coupling required during system test. If this bit is set to 1, and the SIRTEST bit is set to 0, the UARTTXD path is fed through to the UARTRXD path. In either SIR mode or UART mode, when this bit is set, the modem outputs are also fed through to the modem inputs. This bit is cleared to 0 on reset, to disable loopback.

fields.name: TXE
fields.description: Transmit enable. If this bit is set to 1, the transmit section of the UART is enabled. Data transmission occurs for either UART signals, or SIR signals depending on the setting of the SIREN bit. When the UART is disabled in the middle of transmission, it completes the current character before stopping.

fields.name: RXE
fields.description: Receive enable. If this bit is set to 1, the receive section of the UART is enabled. Data reception occurs for either UART signals or SIR signals depending on the setting of the SIREN bit. When the UART is disabled in the middle of reception, it completes the current character before stopping.

fields.name: DTR
fields.description: Data transmit ready. This bit is the complement of the UART data transmit ready, nUARTDTR, modem status output. That is, when the bit is programmed to a 1 then nUARTDTR is LOW.

fields.name: RTS
fields.description: Request to send. This bit is the complement of the UART request to send, nUARTRTS, modem status output. That is, when the bit is programmed to a 1 then nUARTRTS is LOW.

fields.name: OUT1
fields.description: This bit is the complement of the UART Out1 (nUARTOut1) modem status output. That is, when the bit is programmed to a 1 the output is 0. For DTE this can be used as Data Carrier Detect (DCD).

fields.name: OUT2
fields.description: This bit is the complement of the UART Out2 (nUARTOut2) modem status output. That is, when the bit is programmed to a 1, the output is 0. For DTE this can be used as Ring Indicator (RI).

fields.name: RTSEN
fields.description: RTS hardware flow control enable. If this bit is set to 1, RTS hardware flow control is enabled. Data is only requested when there is space in the receive FIFO for it to be received.

fields.name: CTSEN
fields.description: CTS hardware flow control enable. If this bit is set to 1, CTS hardware flow control is enabled. Data is only transmitted when the nUARTCTS signal is asserted.

registers.description: Control Register, UARTCR

registers.name: UARTIFLS

fields.name: TXIFLSEL
fields.description: Transmit interrupt FIFO level select. The trigger points for the transmit interrupt are as follows: b000 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 1 / 8 full b001 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 1 / 4 full b010 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 1 / 2 full b011 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 3 / 4 full b100 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 7 / 8 full b101-b111 = reserved.

fields.name: RXIFLSEL
fields.description: Receive interrupt FIFO level select. The trigger points for the receive interrupt are as follows: b000 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 1 / 8 full b001 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 1 / 4 full b010 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 1 / 2 full b011 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 3 / 4 full b100 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 7 / 8 full b101-b111 = reserved.

registers.description: Interrupt FIFO Level Select Register, UARTIFLS

registers.name: UARTIMSC

fields.name: RIMIM
fields.description: nUARTRI modem interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTRIINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTRIINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

fields.name: CTSMIM
fields.description: nUARTCTS modem interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTCTSINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTCTSINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

fields.name: DCDMIM
fields.description: nUARTDCD modem interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTDCDINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTDCDINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

fields.name: DSRMIM
fields.description: nUARTDSR modem interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTDSRINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTDSRINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

fields.name: RXIM
fields.description: Receive interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTRXINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTRXINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

fields.name: TXIM
fields.description: Transmit interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTTXINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTTXINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

fields.name: RTIM
fields.description: Receive timeout interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTRTINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTRTINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

fields.name: FEIM
fields.description: Framing error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTFEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTFEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

fields.name: PEIM
fields.description: Parity error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTPEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTPEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

fields.name: BEIM
fields.description: Break error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTBEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTBEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

fields.name: OEIM
fields.description: Overrun error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTOEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTOEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.

registers.description: Interrupt Mask Set/Clear Register, UARTIMSC

registers.name: UARTRIS

fields.name: RIRMIS
fields.description: nUARTRI modem interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTRIINTR interrupt.

fields.name: CTSRMIS
fields.description: nUARTCTS modem interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTCTSINTR interrupt.

fields.name: DCDRMIS
fields.description: nUARTDCD modem interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTDCDINTR interrupt.

fields.name: DSRRMIS
fields.description: nUARTDSR modem interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTDSRINTR interrupt.

fields.name: RXRIS
fields.description: Receive interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTRXINTR interrupt.

fields.name: TXRIS
fields.description: Transmit interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTTXINTR interrupt.

fields.name: RTRIS
fields.description: Receive timeout interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTRTINTR interrupt. a

fields.name: FERIS
fields.description: Framing error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTFEINTR interrupt.

fields.name: PERIS
fields.description: Parity error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTPEINTR interrupt.

fields.name: BERIS
fields.description: Break error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTBEINTR interrupt.

fields.name: OERIS
fields.description: Overrun error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTOEINTR interrupt.

registers.description: Raw Interrupt Status Register, UARTRIS

registers.name: UARTMIS

fields.name: RIMMIS
fields.description: nUARTRI modem masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTRIINTR interrupt.

fields.name: CTSMMIS
fields.description: nUARTCTS modem masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTCTSINTR interrupt.

fields.name: DCDMMIS
fields.description: nUARTDCD modem masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTDCDINTR interrupt.

fields.name: DSRMMIS
fields.description: nUARTDSR modem masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTDSRINTR interrupt.

fields.name: RXMIS
fields.description: Receive masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTRXINTR interrupt.

fields.name: TXMIS
fields.description: Transmit masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTTXINTR interrupt.

fields.name: RTMIS
fields.description: Receive timeout masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTRTINTR interrupt.

fields.name: FEMIS
fields.description: Framing error masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTFEINTR interrupt.

fields.name: PEMIS
fields.description: Parity error masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTPEINTR interrupt.

fields.name: BEMIS
fields.description: Break error masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTBEINTR interrupt.

fields.name: OEMIS
fields.description: Overrun error masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTOEINTR interrupt.

registers.description: Masked Interrupt Status Register, UARTMIS

registers.name: UARTICR

fields.name: RIMIC
fields.description: nUARTRI modem interrupt clear. Clears the UARTRIINTR interrupt.

fields.name: CTSMIC
fields.description: nUARTCTS modem interrupt clear. Clears the UARTCTSINTR interrupt.

fields.name: DCDMIC
fields.description: nUARTDCD modem interrupt clear. Clears the UARTDCDINTR interrupt.

fields.name: DSRMIC
fields.description: nUARTDSR modem interrupt clear. Clears the UARTDSRINTR interrupt.

fields.name: RXIC
fields.description: Receive interrupt clear. Clears the UARTRXINTR interrupt.

fields.name: TXIC
fields.description: Transmit interrupt clear. Clears the UARTTXINTR interrupt.

fields.name: RTIC
fields.description: Receive timeout interrupt clear. Clears the UARTRTINTR interrupt.

fields.name: FEIC
fields.description: Framing error interrupt clear. Clears the UARTFEINTR interrupt.

fields.name: PEIC
fields.description: Parity error interrupt clear. Clears the UARTPEINTR interrupt.

fields.name: BEIC
fields.description: Break error interrupt clear. Clears the UARTBEINTR interrupt.

fields.name: OEIC
fields.description: Overrun error interrupt clear. Clears the UARTOEINTR interrupt.

registers.description: Interrupt Clear Register, UARTICR

registers.name: UARTDMACR

fields.name: RXDMAE
fields.description: Receive DMA enable. If this bit is set to 1, DMA for the receive FIFO is enabled.

fields.name: TXDMAE
fields.description: Transmit DMA enable. If this bit is set to 1, DMA for the transmit FIFO is enabled.

fields.name: DMAONERR
fields.description: DMA on error. If this bit is set to 1, the DMA receive request outputs, UARTRXDMASREQ or UARTRXDMABREQ, are disabled when the UART error interrupt is asserted.

registers.description: DMA Control Register, UARTDMACR

fields.name: CONTROLLER_EN
fields.description: Enable controller

fields.name: HOST_NDEVICE
fields.description: Device mode = 0, Host mode = 1

fields.name: SIM_TIMING
fields.description: Reduced timings for simulation

registers.description: Main control register

registers.name: SOF_WR
registers.description: Set the SOF (Start of Frame) frame number in the host controller. The SOF packet is sent every 1ms and the host will increment the frame number by 1 each time.

registers.name: SOF_RD
registers.description: Read the last SOF (Start of Frame) frame number seen. In device mode the last SOF received from the host. In host mode the last SOF sent by the host.

registers.name: SIE_CTRL

fields.name: START_TRANS
fields.description: Host: Start transaction

fields.name: SEND_SETUP
fields.description: Host: Send Setup packet

fields.name: SEND_DATA
fields.description: Host: Send transaction (OUT from host)

fields.name: RECEIVE_DATA
fields.description: Host: Receive transaction (IN to host)

fields.name: STOP_TRANS
fields.description: Host: Stop transaction

fields.name: PREAMBLE_EN
fields.description: Host: Preable enable for LS device on FS hub

fields.name: SOF_SYNC
fields.description: Host: Delay packet(s) until after SOF

fields.name: SOF_EN
fields.description: Host: Enable SOF generation (for full speed bus)

fields.name: KEEP_ALIVE_EN
fields.description: Host: Enable keep alive packet (for low speed bus)

fields.name: VBUS_EN
fields.description: Host: Enable VBUS

fields.name: RESUME
fields.description: Device: Remote wakeup. Device can initiate its own resume after suspend.

fields.name: RESET_BUS
fields.description: Host: Reset bus

fields.name: PULLDOWN_EN
fields.description: Host: Enable pull down resistors

fields.name: PULLUP_EN
fields.description: Device: Enable pull up resistor

fields.name: RPU_OPT
fields.description: Device: Pull-up strength (0=1K2, 1=2k3)

fields.name: TRANSCEIVER_PD
fields.description: Power down bus transceiver

fields.name: DIRECT_DM
fields.description: Direct control of DM

fields.name: DIRECT_DP
fields.description: Direct control of DP

fields.name: DIRECT_EN
fields.description: Direct bus drive enable

fields.name: EP0_INT_NAK
fields.description: Device: Set bit in EP_STATUS_STALL_NAK when EP0 sends a NAK

fields.name: EP0_INT_2BUF
fields.description: Device: Set bit in BUFF_STATUS for every 2 buffers completed on EP0

fields.name: EP0_INT_1BUF
fields.description: Device: Set bit in BUFF_STATUS for every buffer completed on EP0

fields.name: EP0_DOUBLE_BUF
fields.description: Device: EP0 single buffered = 0, double buffered = 1

fields.name: EP0_INT_STALL
fields.description: Device: Set bit in EP_STATUS_STALL_NAK when EP0 sends a STALL

registers.description: SIE control register

registers.name: SIE_STATUS

fields.name: VBUS_DETECTED
fields.description: Device: VBUS Detected

fields.name: LINE_STATE
fields.description: USB bus line state

fields.name: SUSPENDED
fields.description: Bus in suspended state. Valid for device and host. Host and device will go into suspend if neither Keep Alive / SOF frames are enabled.

fields.name: SPEED
fields.description: Host: device speed. Disconnected = 00, LS = 01, FS = 10

fields.name: VBUS_OVER_CURR
fields.description: VBUS over current detected

fields.name: RESUME
fields.description: Host: Device has initiated a remote resume. Device: host has initiated a resume.

fields.name: CONNECTED
fields.description: Device: connected

fields.name: SETUP_REC
fields.description: Device: Setup packet received

fields.name: TRANS_COMPLETE
fields.description:
Transaction complete.

                            Raised by device if:

                            * An IN or OUT packet is sent with the `LAST_BUFF` bit set in the buffer control register

                            Raised by host if:

                            * A setup packet is sent when no data in or data out transaction follows * An IN packet is received and the `LAST_BUFF` bit is set in the buffer control register * An IN packet is received with zero length * An OUT packet is sent and the `LAST_BUFF` bit is set

fields.name: BUS_RESET
fields.description: Device: bus reset received

fields.name: CRC_ERROR
fields.description: CRC Error. Raised by the Serial RX engine.

fields.name: BIT_STUFF_ERROR
fields.description: Bit Stuff Error. Raised by the Serial RX engine.

fields.name: RX_OVERFLOW
fields.description: RX overflow is raised by the Serial RX engine if the incoming data is too fast.

fields.name: RX_TIMEOUT
fields.description: RX timeout is raised by both the host and device if an ACK is not received in the maximum time specified by the USB spec.

fields.name: NAK_REC
fields.description: Host: NAK received

fields.name: STALL_REC
fields.description: Host: STALL received

fields.name: ACK_REC
fields.description: ACK received. Raised by both host and device.

fields.name: DATA_SEQ_ERROR
fields.description:
Data Sequence Error.

                            The device can raise a sequence error in the following conditions:

                            * A SETUP packet is received followed by a DATA1 packet (data phase should always be DATA0) * An OUT packet is received from the host but doesn't match the data pid in the buffer control register read from DPSRAM

                            The host can raise a data sequence error in the following conditions:

                            * An IN packet from the device has the wrong data PID

registers.description: SIE status register

registers.name: INT_EP_CTRL

fields.name: INT_EP_ACTIVE
fields.description: Host: Enable interrupt endpoint 1 => 15

registers.description: interrupt endpoint control register

registers.name: BUFF_STATUS
registers.description: Buffer status register. A bit set here indicates that a buffer has completed on the endpoint (if the buffer interrupt is enabled). It is possible for 2 buffers to be completed, so clearing the buffer status bit may instantly re set it on the next clock cycle.

registers.name: BUFF_CPU_SHOULD_HANDLE
registers.description: Which of the double buffers should be handled. Only valid if using an interrupt per buffer (i.e. not per 2 buffers). Not valid for host interrupt endpoint polling because they are only single buffered.

registers.name: EP_ABORT
registers.description: Device only: Can be set to ignore the buffer control register for this endpoint in case you would like to revoke a buffer. A NAK will be sent for every access to the endpoint until this bit is cleared. A corresponding bit in `EP_ABORT_DONE` is set when it is safe to modify the buffer control register.

registers.name: EP_ABORT_DONE
registers.description: Device only: Used in conjunction with `EP_ABORT`. Set once an endpoint is idle so the programmer knows it is safe to modify the buffer control register.

registers.name: EP_STALL_ARM
registers.description: Device: this bit must be set in conjunction with the `STALL` bit in the buffer control register to send a STALL on EP0. The device controller clears these bits when a SETUP packet is received because the USB spec requires that a STALL condition is cleared when a SETUP packet is received.

registers.name: NAK_POLL

fields.name: DELAY_LS
fields.description: NAK polling interval for a low speed device

fields.name: DELAY_FS
fields.description: NAK polling interval for a full speed device

registers.description: Used by the host controller. Sets the wait time in microseconds before trying again if the device replies with a NAK.

registers.name: EP_STATUS_STALL_NAK
registers.description: Device: bits are set when the `IRQ_ON_NAK` or `IRQ_ON_STALL` bits are set. For EP0 this comes from `SIE_CTRL`. For all other endpoints it comes from the endpoint control register.

registers.name: USB_MUXING
registers.description: Where to connect the USB controller. Should be to_phy by default.

registers.name: USB_PWR
registers.description: Overrides for the power signals in the event that the VBUS signals are not hooked up to GPIO. Set the value of the override and then the override enable so switch over to the override value.

registers.name: USBPHY_DIRECT

fields.name: DP_PULLUP_HISEL
fields.description: when dp_pullup_en is set high, this enables second resistor. 0 - Pull = Rpu2; 1 - Pull = Rpu1 + Rpu2

fields.name: DP_PULLUP_EN
fields.description: Value to drive to USB PHY when override enable is set (which will override the default value or value driven from USB controller

fields.name: DP_PULLDN_EN
fields.description:
Value to drive to USB PHY when override enable is set (which will override the default value or value driven from USB controller 
                            1 - Enable Rpd on DPP

fields.name: DM_PULLUP_HISEL
fields.description: when dm_pullup_en is set high, this enables second resistor. 0 - Pull = Rpu2; 1 - Pull = Rpu1 + Rpu2

fields.name: DM_PULLUP_EN
fields.description:
Value to drive to USB PHY when override enable is set (which will override the default value or value driven from USB controller 
                            1 - Enable Rpu on DPM

fields.name: DM_PULLDN_EN
fields.description:
Value to drive to USB PHY when override enable is set (which will override the default value or value driven from USB controller 
                            1 - Enable Rpd on DPM

fields.name: TX_DP_OE
fields.description:
Value to drive to USB PHY when override enable is set (which will override the default value or value driven from USB controller 
                            TX_SEMODE=0, OE for DPP/DPM diff pair. 0 - DPP/DPM in Hi-Z state; 1 - DPP/DPM driving 
                            TX_SEMODE=1, OE for DPP only. 0 - DPP in Hi-Z state; 1 - DPP driving

fields.name: TX_DM_OE
fields.description:
Value to drive to USB PHY when override enable is set (which will override the default value or value driven from USB controller 
                            TX_SEMODE=0, Ignored. 
                            TX_SEMODE=1, OE for DPM only. 0 - DPM in Hi-Z state; 1 - DPM driving

fields.name: TX_DP
fields.description:
Value to drive to USB PHY when override enable is set (which will override the default value or value driven from USB controller 
                            TX_SEMODE=0, Drives DPP/DPM diff pair. TX_DP_OE=1 to enable drive. DPP=TX_DP, DPM=~TX_DP 
                            TX_SEMODE=1, Drives DPP only. TX_DP_OE=1 to enable drive. DPP=TX_DP

fields.name: TX_DM
fields.description:
Value to drive to USB PHY when override enable is set (which will override the default value or value driven from USB controller 
                            TX_SEMODE=0, Ignored 
                            TX_SEMODE=1, Drives DPM only. TX_DM_OE=1 to enable drive. DPM=TX_DM

fields.name: RX_DP

fields.description:

fields.name: INTERRUPT_PER_DOUBLE_BUFF
fields.description: Trigger an interrupt each time both buffers are done. Only valid in double buffered mode.

fields.name: INTERRUPT_PER_BUFF
fields.description: Trigger an interrupt each time a buffer is done.

fields.name: DOUBLE_BUFFERED
fields.description: This endpoint is double buffered.

fields.name: ENABLE
fields.description: Enable this endpoint. The device will not reply to any packets for this endpoint if this bit is not set.

fields.name: BUFFER_ADDRESS
fields.description: 64 byte aligned buffer address for this EP (bits 0-5 are ignored). Relative to the start of the DPRAM.

registers.name: EP0_IN_BUFFER_CONTROL

fields.name: LENGTH_0
fields.description: The length of the data in buffer 0.

fields.name: AVAILABLE_0
fields.description: Buffer 0 is available. This bit is set to indicate the buffer can be used by the controller. The controller clears the available bit when writing the status back.

fields.name: STALL
fields.description: Reply with a stall (valid for both buffers).

fields.name: RESET
fields.description: Reset the buffer selector to buffer 0.

fields.name: PID_0
fields.description: The data pid of buffer 0.

fields.name: LAST_0
fields.description: Buffer 0 is the last buffer of the transfer.

fields.name: FULL_0
fields.description: Buffer 0 is full. For an IN transfer (TX to the host) the bit is set to indicate the data is valid. For an OUT transfer (RX from the host) this bit should be left as a 0. The host will set it when it has filled the buffer with data.

fields.name: LENGTH_1
fields.description: The length of the data in buffer 1.

fields.name: AVAILABLE_1
fields.description: Buffer 1 is available. This bit is set to indicate the buffer can be used by the controller. The controller clears the available bit when writing the status back.

fields.name: DOUBLE_BUFFER_ISO_OFFSET
fields.description:
The number of bytes buffer 1 is offset from buffer 0 in Isochronous mode. Only valid in double buffered mode for an Isochronous endpoint. 
                            For a non Isochronous endpoint the offset is always 64 bytes.

fields.name: PID_1
fields.description: The data pid of buffer 1.

fields.name: LAST_1
fields.description: Buffer 1 is the last buffer of the transfer.

fields.name: FULL_1
fields.description: Buffer 1 is full. For an IN transfer (TX to the host) the bit is set to indicate the data is valid. For an OUT transfer (RX from the host) this bit should be left as a 0. The host will set it when it has filled the buffer with data.

registers.description:
Buffer control for both buffers of an endpoint. Fields ending in a _1 are for buffer 1. 
                    Fields ending in a _0 are for buffer 0. Buffer 1 controls are only valid if the endpoint is in double buffered mode.

                            For a non Isochronous endpoint the offset is always 64 bytes.

fields.name: PID_1
fields.description: The data pid of buffer 1.

fields.name: LAST_1
fields.description: Buffer 1 is the last buffer of the transfer.

fields.name: FULL_1
fields.description: Buffer 1 is full. For an IN transfer (TX to the host) the bit is set to indicate the data is valid. For an OUT transfer (RX from the host) this bit should be left as a 0. The host will set it when it has filled the buffer with data.

registers.description:
Buffer control for both buffers of an endpoint. Fields ending in a _1 are for buffer 1. 
                    Fields ending in a _0 are for buffer 0. Buffer 1 controls are only valid if the endpoint is in double buffered mode.

registers.name: EP2_IN_BUFFER_CONTROL

fields.name: LENGTH_0
fields.description: The length of the data in buffer 0.

fields.name: AVAILABLE_0
fields.description: Buffer 0 is available. This bit is set to indicate the buffer can be used by the controller. The controller clears the available bit when writing the status back.

fields.name: STALL
fields.description: Reply with a stall (valid for both buffers).

fields.name: RESET
fields.description: Reset the buffer selector to buffer 0.

fields.name: PID_0
fields.description: The data pid of buffer 0.

fields.name: LAST_0
fields.description: Buffer 0 is the last buffer of the transfer.

fields.description: Buffer 0 is full. For an IN transfer (TX to the host) the bit is set to indicate the data is valid. For an OUT transfer (RX from the host) this bit should be left as a 0. The host will set it when it has filled the buffer with data.

fields.description: Buffer 0 is full. For an IN transfer (TX to the host) the bit is set to indicate the data is valid. For an OUT transfer (RX from the host) this bit should be left as a 0. The host will set it when it has filled the buffer with data.

fields.name: LENGTH_1
fields.description: The length of the data in buffer 1.

fields.name: AVAILABLE_1
fields.description: Buffer 1 is available. This bit is set to indicate the buffer can be used by the controller. The controller clears the available bit when writing the status back.

fields.name: DOUBLE_BUFFER_ISO_OFFSET
fields.description:
The number of bytes buffer 1 is offset from buffer 0 in Isochronous mode. Only valid in double buffered mode for an Isochronous endpoint. 
                            For a non Isochronous endpoint the offset is always 64 bytes.

fields.name: PID_1
fields.description: The data pid of buffer 1.

fields.description: Buffer 1 is the last buffer of the transfer.

fields.description: Buffer 1 is full. For an IN transfer (TX to the host) the bit is set to indicate the data is valid. For an OUT transfer (RX from the host) this bit should be left as a 0. The host will set it when it has filled the buffer with data.

fields.description: Buffer 0 is available. This bit is set to indicate the buffer can be used by the controller. The controller clears the available bit when writing the status back.

fields.name: STALL
fields.description: Reply with a stall (valid for both buffers).

fields.name: RESET
fields.description: Reset the buffer selector to buffer 0.

fields.name: PID_0
fields.description: The data pid of buffer 0.

fields.name: LAST_0
fields.description: Buffer 0 is the last buffer of the transfer.

fields.name: FULL_0
fields.description: Buffer 0 is full. For an IN transfer (TX to the host) the bit is set to indicate the data is valid. For an OUT transfer (RX from the host) this bit should be left as a 0. The host will set it when it has filled the buffer with data.

fields.name: LENGTH_1
fields.description: The length of the data in buffer 1.

fields.name: AVAILABLE_1
fields.description: Buffer 1 is available. This bit is set to indicate the buffer can be used by the controller. The controller clears the available bit when writing the status back.

fields.name: DOUBLE_BUFFER_ISO_OFFSET
fields.description:
The number of bytes buffer 1 is offset from buffer 0 in Isochronous mode. Only valid in double buffered mode for an Isochronous endpoint. 
                            For a non Isochronous endpoint the offset is always 64 bytes.

fields.name: PID_1
fields.description: The data pid of buffer 1.

fields.name: LAST_1
fields.description: Buffer 1 is the last buffer of the transfer.

fields.name: FULL_1
fields.description: Buffer 1 is full. For an IN transfer (TX to the host) the bit is set to indicate the data is valid. For an OUT transfer (RX from the host) this bit should be left as a 0. The host will set it when it has filled the buffer with data.

registers.description:
Buffer control for both buffers of an endpoint. Fields ending in a _1 are for buffer 1. 
                    Fields ending in a _0 are for buffer 0. Buffer 1 controls are only valid if the endpoint is in double buffered mode.

VREG_AND_CHIP_RESET.name: VREG_AND_CHIP_RESET
VREG_AND_CHIP_RESET.description: control and status for on-chip voltage regulator and chip level reset subsystem

registers.name: VREG

fields.name: EN
fields.description:
enable 
                            0=not enabled, 1=enabled

fields.name: HIZ
fields.description:
high impedance mode select 
                            0=not in high impedance mode, 1=in high impedance mode

fields.name: ROK
fields.description:
regulation status 
                            0=not in regulation, 1=in regulation

registers.description: Voltage regulator control and status

registers.name: BOD

fields.name: EN
fields.description:
enable 
                            0=not enabled, 1=enabled

registers.description: brown-out detection control

registers.name: CHIP_RESET

fields.name: HAD_POR
fields.description: Last reset was from the power-on reset or brown-out detection blocks

fields.name: HAD_RUN
fields.description: Last reset was from the RUN pin

fields.name: HAD_PSM_RESTART
fields.description: Last reset was from the debug port

fields.name: PSM_RESTART_FLAG
fields.description:
This is set by psm_restart from the debugger. 
                            Its purpose is to branch bootcode to a safe mode when the debugger has issued a psm_restart in order to recover from a boot lock-up. 
                            In the safe mode the debugger can repair the boot code, clear this flag then reboot the processor.

registers.description: Chip reset control and status

registers.name: CTRL

fields.name: TIME
fields.description: Indicates the number of ticks / 2 (see errata RP2040-E1) before a watchdog reset will be triggered

fields.name: PAUSE_JTAG
fields.description: Pause the watchdog timer when JTAG is accessing the bus fabric

fields.name: PAUSE_DBG0
fields.description: Pause the watchdog timer when processor 0 is in debug mode

fields.name: PAUSE_DBG1
fields.description: Pause the watchdog timer when processor 1 is in debug mode

fields.name: ENABLE
fields.description: When not enabled the watchdog timer is paused

fields.name: TRIGGER
fields.description: Trigger a watchdog reset

registers.description:
Watchdog control 
                    The rst_wdsel register determines which subsystems are reset when the watchdog is triggered. 
                    The watchdog can be triggered in software.

registers.name: LOAD
registers.description: Load the watchdog timer. The maximum setting is 0xffffff which corresponds to 0xffffff / 2 ticks before triggering a watchdog reset (see errata RP2040-E1).

registers.name: REASON
registers.description: Logs the reason for the last reset. Both bits are zero for the case of a hardware reset.

registers.name: SCRATCH0
registers.description: Scratch register. Information persists through soft reset of the chip.

registers.name: SCRATCH1
registers.description: Scratch register. Information persists through soft reset of the chip.

registers.name: SCRATCH2
registers.description: Scratch register. Information persists through soft reset of the chip.

registers.name: SCRATCH3
registers.description: Scratch register. Information persists through soft reset of the chip.

registers.name: SCRATCH4
registers.description: Scratch register. Information persists through soft reset of the chip.

registers.name: SCRATCH5
registers.description: Scratch register. Information persists through soft reset of the chip.

registers.name: SCRATCH6
registers.description: Scratch register. Information persists through soft reset of the chip.

registers.name: SCRATCH7
registers.description: Scratch register. Information persists through soft reset of the chip.

registers.name: TICK

fields.name: CYCLES
fields.description: Total number of clk_tick cycles before the next tick.

fields.name: ENABLE
fields.description: start / stop tick generation

fields.name: RUNNING
fields.description: Is the tick generator running?

fields.name: COUNT
fields.description: Count down timer: the remaining number clk_tick cycles before the next tick is generated.

registers.description: Controls the tick generator

registers.name: CTRL

fields.name: EN
fields.description:
When 1, enable the cache. When the cache is disabled, all XIP accesses 
                            will go straight to the flash, without querying the cache. When enabled, 
                            cacheable XIP accesses will query the cache, and the flash will 
                            not be accessed if the tag matches and the valid bit is set.

                            If the cache is enabled, cache-as-SRAM accesses have no effect on the 
                            cache data RAM, and will produce a bus error response.

fields.name: ERR_BADWRITE
fields.description:
When 1, writes to any alias other than 0x0 (caching, allocating) 
                            will produce a bus fault. When 0, these writes are silently ignored. 
                            In either case, writes to the 0x0 alias will deallocate on tag match, 
                            as usual.

fields.name: POWER_DOWN
fields.description:
When 1, the cache memories are powered down. They retain state, 
                            but can not be accessed. This reduces static power dissipation. 
                            Writing 1 to this bit forces CTRL_EN to 0, i.e. the cache cannot 
                            be enabled when powered down. 
                            Cache-as-SRAM accesses will produce a bus error response when 
                            the cache is powered down.

registers.description: Cache control

registers.name: FLUSH

fields.name: FLUSH
fields.description:
Write 1 to flush the cache. This clears the tag memory, but 
                            the data memory retains its contents. (This means cache-as-SRAM 
                            contents is not affected by flush or reset.) 
                            Reading will hold the bus (stall the processor) until the flush 
                            completes. Alternatively STAT can be polled until completion.

registers.description: Cache Flush control

registers.name: STAT

fields.name: FLUSH_READY
fields.description:
Reads as 0 while a cache flush is in progress, and 1 otherwise. 
                            The cache is flushed whenever the XIP block is reset, and also 
                            when requested via the FLUSH register.

fields.name: FIFO_EMPTY
fields.description: When 1, indicates the XIP streaming FIFO is completely empty.

fields.name: FIFO_FULL
fields.description:
When 1, indicates the XIP streaming FIFO is completely full. 
                            The streaming FIFO is 2 entries deep, so the full and empty 
                            flag allow its level to be ascertained.

registers.description: Cache Status

registers.name: CTR_HIT

fields.name: CTR_HIT
fields.description:
A 32 bit saturating counter that increments upon each cache hit, 
                            i.e. when an XIP access is serviced directly from cached data. 
                            Write any value to clear.

registers.description: Cache Hit counter

registers.name: CTR_ACC

fields.name: CTR_ACC
fields.description:
A 32 bit saturating counter that increments upon each XIP access, 
                            whether the cache is hit or not. This includes noncacheable accesses. 
                            Write any value to clear.

registers.description: Cache Access counter

registers.name: STREAM_ADDR

fields.name: STREAM_ADDR
fields.description:
The address of the next word to be streamed from flash to the streaming FIFO. 
                            Increments automatically after each flash access. 
                            Write the initial access address here before starting a streaming read.

registers.description: FIFO stream address

registers.name: STREAM_CTR

fields.name: STREAM_CTR
fields.description:
Write a nonzero value to start a streaming read. This will then 
                            progress in the background, using flash idle cycles to transfer 
                            a linear data block from flash to the streaming FIFO. 
                            Decrements automatically (1 at a time) as the stream 
                            progresses, and halts on reaching 0. 
                            Write 0 to halt an in-progress stream, and discard any in-flight 
                            read, so that a new stream can immediately be started (after 
                            draining the FIFO and reinitialising STREAM_ADDR)

registers.description: FIFO stream control

registers.name: STREAM_FIFO

fields.name: STREAM_FIFO
fields.description:
Streamed data is buffered here, for retrieval by the system DMA. 
                            This FIFO can also be accessed via the XIP_AUX slave, to avoid exposing 
                            the DMA to bus stalls caused by other XIP traffic.

registers.description: FIFO stream data

registers.name: CTRL

fields.name: FREQ_RANGE
fields.description: Frequency range. An invalid setting will retain the previous value. The actual value being used can be read from STATUS_FREQ_RANGE. This resets to 0xAA0 and cannot be changed.

fields.name: ENABLE
fields.description:
On power-up this field is initialised to DISABLE and the chip runs from the ROSC. 
                            If the chip has subsequently been programmed to run from the XOSC then DISABLE may lock-up the chip. If this is a concern then run the clk_ref from the ROSC and enable the clk_sys RESUS feature. 
                            The 12-bit code is intended to give some protection against accidental writes. An invalid setting will enable the oscillator.

registers.description: Crystal Oscillator Control

registers.name: STATUS

fields.name: FREQ_RANGE
fields.description: The current frequency range setting, always reads 0

fields.name: ENABLED
fields.description: Oscillator is enabled but not necessarily running and stable, resets to 0

fields.name: BADWRITE
fields.description: An invalid value has been written to CTRL_ENABLE or CTRL_FREQ_RANGE or DORMANT

fields.name: STABLE
fields.description: Oscillator is running and stable

registers.description: Crystal Oscillator Status

registers.name: DORMANT

fields.name: DORMANT
fields.description:
This is used to save power by pausing the XOSC 
                            On power-up this field is initialised to WAKE 
                            An invalid write will also select WAKE 
                            Warning: stop the PLLs before selecting dormant mode 
                            Warning: setup the irq before selecting dormant mode

registers.description: Crystal Oscillator pause control

registers.name: STARTUP

fields.name: DELAY
fields.description: in multiples of 256*xtal_period. The reset value of 0xc4 corresponds to approx 50 000 cycles.

fields.name: X4
fields.description: Multiplies the startup_delay by 4. This is of little value to the user given that the delay can be programmed directly.

registers.description: Controls the startup delay

registers.name: COUNT
registers.description:
A down counter running at the xosc frequency which counts to zero and stops. 
                    To start the counter write a non-zero value. 
                    Can be used for short software pauses when setting up time sensitive hardware.
